alert.note: Alert for Hooker; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 3:27AM CST until January 12 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Hooker and Western Cherry Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM Friday to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
